flipsiesNft.title: Flipsies NFT
flipsiesNft.text1: Flipsies NFTs are a series of 7,803 playing cards on the BitTorrent blockchain, each NFT is uniquely programmatically traited and auto-colored.
flipsiesNft.text3: 2,600 kings, 2,601 queens, 2,601 jacks, 25 jokers and 7 stories.
flipsiesNft.text4: Our platform has an automatic buy-back system that buys NFTs and distributes them as jackpot prizes for users playing Flipsies, this feature will keep the floor rising regardless of “pumping” by holders. Flipsies will also have a holding system, the earning rate of this system is based on rarity, the rarer your NFT is, the more it will earn.
flipsiesNft.text5: Throughout the years different nicknames have been given to distinctive playing cards. Most of these bynames come from poker games, here are a few of the classics, these are the seven

explore.title: Explore Flipsies NFT
explore.tryLuck: Try your luck, buy a random NFT now and see which one you'll get!
explore.toGainAccess: To gain access to our NFT marketplace, play-to-win or mint 1, 3 or 5 randomly generated NFTs!
explore.notEligible: is not eligible for any Jackpot NFTs

kingOfHearts.title: Suicide King
kingOfHearts.label: The King of Hearts is usually depicted with a sword, although in the flipsies deck he is armed with a color changing egg. He is typically referred to as the "suicide king" because on a traditional deck he is pictured as stabbing himself with a sword, or at least holding a sword behind his head.

kingOfDiamonds.title: Man With The Axe
kingOfDiamonds.label: This designation for the King of Diamonds reflects the fact that this is the only king not carrying a sword. That is why he is often referred to as The Man With The Axe. This card is frequently designated as wildcards in draw poker. At the local card game, It was common to hear "the game is seven card high/low with a buy on the last card. And just to make it more interesting, the man with the axe takes all.

queenOfSpades.title: Black Widow
queenOfSpades.label: The nickname "Black Widow" for the Queen of Spades is closely connected with the game of Hearts. In this trick-taking game, the idea is to avoid collecting points, with Hearts cards all worth one point each, while the Queen of Spades costs a massive 13 penalty points. In old-school poker games, you’d sometimes hear her referred to as Calamity Jane, a famous frontierswoman that loved to play 5-card stud.

queenOfClubs.title: Flower Queen
queenOfClubs.label: The Queen of Clubs is known as the "Queen of flowers" or the "Flower Queen" for an obvious reason - she is usually depicted holding a Flower. Also called the "Mother Mary" card or the "Queen of Queens" this is also the most speculated card for tarot readings and other psychic beliefs.

jackOfDiamonds.title: Laughing Boy
jackOfDiamonds.label: Jacks are also called Knaves, and are inferior to the more regal Kings and Queens, making them more playful. The Jack of Diamonds is known as the Laughing Boy, and in some variations of Poker and Black Jack, players are expected to chuckle every time this card is played or drawn.

jackOfSpadesAndJackOfHearts.title: One Eyed Jacks
jackOfSpadesAndJackOfHearts.label: Unlike most of the other court cards, the Jack of Spades and the Jack of Hearts both have a side profile, hence their designation as "one-eyed Jacks." One eyed jacks is a phrase most often used to describe cards that are being declared wild. It is a convenient way to specify that half the jacks should be wild, and as an ancient part of poker slang, it's also just fun to say. One eyed jacks are often paired with the "Suicide King" in declaring wild cards.

buyback.title: Buyback system:
buyback.description: Our platform has an automatic buy-back system that buys NFTs and distributes them as jackpot prizes for users playing Flipsies, this feature will keep the floor rising regardless of “pumping” by holders.
buyback.description1: Platform has automatically buyback system that always provide nfts for Jackpot winners
buyback.description2: 100% payout for Jackpot any time guarantee

stacking.title: Holding system:
stacking.description: The longer you hold a NFT the more rewards you will get. The higher the rarity score your tokens have the more rewards you will get. You will get rewards as cash back according to the amount of bets that you did on Flipsies platform. Starting rates for owning NFTs 1 month - 3% trx, 2 months - 6% trx, 1 year - 36% trx, 2 years - 72% trx, 3 years - 108% trx, 4 years - 144% trx. You can claim rewards every 7 days from token purchasing
stacking.description1: The more NFTs you have and the longer you hold, the more rewards you will earn
stacking.description2: The higher the rarity score your NFT has the more rewards you will get
stacking.description3: You will get rewards as cash back according to amount of bets that you place on Flipsies platform
stacking.description5: 1 month - 3% trx, 2 months - 6% trx, 1 year - 36% trx, 2 years - 72% trx, 3 years - 108% trx, 4 years - 144% trx
stacking.description6: You can claim rewards every 7 days from token purchasing.

allTokens.description: All tokens will be divided into groups according to the purchase date. For example all tokens(NFTs) that a user has bought on the 22nd of April will be put into one group. All tokens that a user has bought on the 23 of April will be put into another groups. If this user decides to sell any amount of tokens from some of these groups, so in this case all rewards will be fixed and calculation for further rewards will continue from the start. Reward calculation for any groups will calculate separately from each other.
allTokens.description1: All tokens will be devided into groups according to purchase date. For example all tokens that user has bought on the 22nd of April will be put into one group.All tokens that user has bought on the 23 of April will be put into another groups.If this user decides to sell any amount of tokens from some of these groups so in this case all rewards will be fixed and calculation for further rewards will continue from the start. That means  from 1st day of holding. Exactly in the same way if user just bought these tokens. Reward calculation for any groups will calculate separately from each other.

formula.beforeTitle: Here is the formula for total rate calculation for one group:
formula.title: (CurrentTimeRate + (T * B)  ) + R
formula.description1: *Will also be getting cashback as additional rewards
formula.description2: Total token amount - 1 (since there is not additional reward for owning just 1 token)
formula.description3: Additional rewards for the number of tokens
formula.description4: The sum of all tokens rarity in one group
formula.description5: *Note that you will be also getting cashback as additional rewards
formula.description6: T : total tokes amount - 1 (since there is not additional reward for owning just 1 token)
formula.description7: B : additional rewards for the number of tokens.
formula.description8: R: the sum of all tokens rarity in one group
